title: CGS Tracking/Imagery Analyst and Training Supervisor
description: Operated CGS Systems to provide eyes on support to ground forces by tracking movement in specified locations. Assisting lower echelons with workloads by answering RFI’s and watching additional areas covered by JSTARS. Maintaining all CGS systems to USF-I standards. Working with crypto, and establishing communications with JSTARS operators to ensure mission success. Training with FMV, UAV operators and pilots in Balad, Iraq. Assisting in eyes on missions for the Predator as well as air route clearance and surveillance. •Live and Forensic Imagery analysis performed on a daily basis. Worked with HUMINT and SIGINT to combine information to gain the necessary knowledge of the missions we were tasked with. •Worked with JSARS Operators to track live movement and communicate with ground operations to intercept illegal activity. •Being the only crossed trained analyst on the team, I was responsible for training new leadership and co-workers on the daily and nightly mission procedures. Briefing senior leadership on findings, reports created from historical data, and new methods to increase mission stability and success.

summary: Jennifer possesses 12 years of experience as an Intelligence/field specializing in HUMINT, IMINT and GEOINT intelligence and Planning operations. She is the SouthEast Regional Business Developer for a company that has over 92M in contracts for both defense and commercial. Her experience includes her tour in Kosovo as the lead analyst supporting EUCOM/NATO forces and a tour in Afghanistan as the Lead All Source Analyst for Regional Command North working directly under the Combined Joint Intelligence Branch, (NATO) and as the liaison of Security Intelligence information and planning to the EUCOM/CENTCOM utilizing a variety of tools She also has done an active duty tour in Iraq where she planned and fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages and digital forensics. Her more recent government contractor experience is in intelligence and systems analysis working as the Cyber Security Intelligence Analyst and Business development for SPACECOM assessing High Threat malware attacking the United States and DOD sytems, Jennifer was the Course Manager/Instructor for INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) for the DCGS/ARC programs hosted at Ft. Belvoir IATP (Intelligence Advance Training Program) and business developer/lead field engineer for the AF.

summary: Jennifer possesses 12 years of experience as an Intelligence/field specializing in HUMINT, IMINT and GEOINT intelligence and Planning operations. She is the SouthEast Regional Business Developer for a company that has over 92M in contracts for both defense and commercial. Her experience includes her tour in Kosovo as the lead analyst supporting EUCOM/NATO forces and a tour in Afghanistan as the Lead All Source Analyst for Regional Command North working directly under the Combined Joint Intelligence Branch, (NATO) and as the liaison of Security Intelligence information and planning to the EUCOM/CENTCOM utilizing a variety of tools She also has done an active duty tour in Iraq where she planned and fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages and digital forensics. Her more recent government contractor experience is in intelligence and systems analysis working as the Cyber Security Intelligence Analyst and Business development for SPACECOM assessing High Threat malware attacking the United States and DOD sytems, Jennifer was the Course Manager/Instructor for INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) for the DCGS/ARC programs hosted at Ft. Belvoir IATP (Intelligence Advance Training Program) and business developer/lead field engineer for the AF.

title: Lead NATO All source Analyst
description: Lead Analyst to Regional Command North overseeing all Regional analysts’ reports. Collected IMINT/GEOINT, HUMINT, SIGINT intelligence to create High Value Target packets, Tasked ISR assets per requirement of mission, analyzed 9 provinces, over 100 districts and reviewed analysts assessments to create products for regional command and Afghanistan leadership. Created daily IED/threat assessments for General and subs. Prepared weekly point papers on key personnel and threat areas for US/NATO Special Forces. Creates Network infrastructure layouts based of various Intel. Created blueprints for Intel sharing between ISAF/ANSF (International/Afghan Security Forces) and presented to Afghan General Wesa at the first Intelligence Conference, which is currently being used at National level. Created predictive high risk assassination targets of GIROA/AFGHAN leadership, network analysis on HAQQANI/AL QAEDA groups and regions. Planned and coordinated high target hostage/capture missions. Acted as liaison between US/NATO on intelligence coordination and solving collection gaps. Used both NATO/US tools for collection ( ARCGIS,ANALYST NOTEBOOK,MFWS(MULTI-FUNCTION WORKSTATION) IGEOSIT,REMOTEVIEW,NATOTOOLBOX,PATHFINDER,QUERYTREE,CIDNE ,WEBTAS)

summary: Jennifer possesses 12 years of experience as an Intelligence/field specializing in HUMINT, IMINT and GEOINT intelligence and Planning operations. She is the SouthEast Regional Business Developer for a company that has over 92M in contracts for both defense and commercial. Her experience includes her tour in Kosovo as the lead analyst supporting EUCOM/NATO forces and a tour in Afghanistan as the Lead All Source Analyst for Regional Command North working directly under the Combined Joint Intelligence Branch, (NATO) and as the liaison of Security Intelligence information and planning to the EUCOM/CENTCOM utilizing a variety of tools She also has done an active duty tour in Iraq where she planned and fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages and digital forensics. Her more recent government contractor experience is in intelligence and systems analysis working as the Cyber Security Intelligence Analyst and Business development for SPACECOM assessing High Threat malware attacking the United States and DOD sytems, Jennifer was the Course Manager/Instructor for INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) for the DCGS/ARC programs hosted at Ft. Belvoir IATP (Intelligence Advance Training Program) and business developer/lead field engineer for the AF.

title: Cyber Intelligence Analyst 4
description: Malware analysis and Countermeasure development Evaluates technical and all source intelligence to predict network groups, capabilities, and intention of threat to DOD systems. Analyzes network events on current operations and conduct research to determine advisory capability and intent. Assesses malware that is being created in foreign countries and determines which likely systems are in threat. Merges data from multiple sources to determine network/intrusion events. Assess digital forensics to predict host network manufacturing and to which targeted system. Static analysis: Virtual Environment Emulation; debugging of executables; API manipulation Creates essential elements of information (EEI'S) and intelligence information reports (IIR) and disseminates to leadership detailing functionality, characteristics, and countermeasure of malware samples. Assesses fuzzer results and plans various offensive capabilities.

title: Course Manager MFWS/ DCGS Instructor
description: Certified instructor under INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) of advance analysis training to government agencies and DOD senior intelligence analysts on ArcGIS, Arcmap, Multi-Function Work Station , Cidne , DCGS-A Tools, Risk Assessments, IED/Road Predictions, Histograms, Geo Raster/Vector Data. Created courseware and sop for MFWS course for deploying analysts on techniques on the theory, procedures and sensor capabilities to produce geospatial and intelligence products

summary: Jennifer possesses 12 years of experience as an Intelligence/field specializing in HUMINT, IMINT and GEOINT intelligence and Planning operations. She is the SouthEast Regional Business Developer for a company that has over 92M in contracts for both defense and commercial. Her experience includes her tour in Kosovo as the lead analyst supporting EUCOM/NATO forces and a tour in Afghanistan as the Lead All Source Analyst for Regional Command North working directly under the Combined Joint Intelligence Branch, (NATO) and as the liaison of Security Intelligence information and planning to the EUCOM/CENTCOM utilizing a variety of tools She also has done an active duty tour in Iraq where she planned and fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages and digital forensics. Her more recent government contractor experience is in intelligence and systems analysis working as the Cyber Security Intelligence Analyst and Business development for SPACECOM assessing High Threat malware attacking the United States and DOD sytems, Jennifer was the Course Manager/Instructor for INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) for the DCGS/ARC programs hosted at Ft. Belvoir IATP (Intelligence Advance Training Program) and business developer/lead field engineer for the AF.

title: Field Engineer/All source analyst/Business Development
description: Trained advance all source analysts the AF Exploitation and Forensics course. This includes knowledge on radar principles, data characterization, current ops, including signal recognition, classification, and signal analysis, and threat patterns. Assisted on gathering data for information systems security monitoring (ISSM) teams in theater. Analyzed signal transformation, radio identification, signal generation, ,electro-optical (EO), spectral, thermal infrared (TIR), ground moving target indicator (GMTI), synthetic aperture radar (SAR), overhead persistent infrared (OPIR), data and imagery and map-based software. Drafted and disseminated intelligence messages to cue other intelligence collectors or consumers in support of the commander's requirements during combat operations. Conducted post-mission analysis of various intelligence for dissemination to the battalion and brigade intelligence offices.

summary: Jennifer possesses 12 years of experience as an Intelligence/field specializing in HUMINT, IMINT and GEOINT intelligence and Planning operations. She is the SouthEast Regional Business Developer for a company that has over 92M in contracts for both defense and commercial. Her experience includes her tour in Kosovo as the lead analyst supporting EUCOM/NATO forces and a tour in Afghanistan as the Lead All Source Analyst for Regional Command North working directly under the Combined Joint Intelligence Branch, (NATO) and as the liaison of Security Intelligence information and planning to the EUCOM/CENTCOM utilizing a variety of tools She also has done an active duty tour in Iraq where she planned and fused Human Intelligence, Signal Intelligence, and Image Intelligence to create detailed target packages and digital forensics. Her more recent government contractor experience is in intelligence and systems analysis working as the Cyber Security Intelligence Analyst and Business development for SPACECOM assessing High Threat malware attacking the United States and DOD sytems, Jennifer was the Course Manager/Instructor for INSCOM (Intelligence Security Command) for the DCGS/ARC programs hosted at Ft. Belvoir IATP (Intelligence Advance Training Program) and business developer/lead field engineer for the AF.

title: Geospatial Analyst
description: Analyst on the common ground station (CGS)/Joint Service Workstation (JSWS) supporting joint surveillance target attack radar system ( JSTARS) . Provided analysis and reporting resulted in the capture and killing of over 72 enemy forces. Combat experience in c2ISR, GMTI imagery intelligence, electronics intelligence; UAV video, RADAR, and electronic intercept sensor operations. Experienced as a CGS operator in CONUS and a 12 month deployment at a OCONUS location. Participated in multiple complex weapon systems tactical fire exercises. Tracked radar returns on an electronic map, determined if enemy or friendly and took appropriate action using satellite and computer equipment; requested use of unmanned aerial vehicle to send back live video in real time to confirm any suspected enemy units locations. Collected, tracked, and analyzed data from intelligence summaries (INSUMS), unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) imagery, Joint Surveillance target attack radar system (JSTARS) near-real-time radar imagery data, commander's tactical terminal/joint tactical terminal (CTT/JTT) signals intelligence (SIGINT) data, and secondary imagery dissemination (SIDS) images. Detected, located, and tracked ground targets and rotary wing and slow-moving fixed wing aircraft. Performed intelligence preparation of the battlefield in support of imagery ground station (IGS) mission planning. Coordinated daily with the fire support officer on current requirements and tasks. Drafted and disseminated intelligence messages to cue other intelligence collectors or consumers in support of the commander's requirements. Correlated intelligence obtained from other intelligence, military, and paramilitary personnel. Selected reconnaissance and IGS sites. Conducted post-mission analysis.

title: Senior Recruiting Specialist | Language Services
description: • Experience conducting community outreach programs targeting the diverse ethnic communities contained on the DoD Strategic Language List (SLL). • Thorough knowledge of cultural, economic, geopolitical, and military issues of the Middle East. • Assisting candidates through the vetting, selection, and onboarding process (hiring process, language tests, CRC, deployment) and continued retention support once they are hired. • Strong track-record of developing SME networks of contacts to identify and source qualified candidates. • Highly-capable of leveraging COTS, web-based and/or proprietary automated candidate tracking systems. • Sourced for languages included, but are not limited to, Arabic (Modern Standard, Maghreb, Iraqi), Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese), French, India (Hindi, Punjabi, Tamil), Indonesian (Indonesian and Japanese), Pashtu (Pashtu-Afghan), Persian (Afghan Dari and Iranian Farsi), Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Turkic (Turkish and Turkmen), and Urdu. African (Somali, Swahili), Kurdish (Kurmanji and Sorani), Philippines (Tagalog), and Uzbek. Be Part of MISSION ESSENTIAL: We integrate peerless talent and technology What we do: Provide Mission-Ready Intelligence Solutions with speed and efficiency. Help customers navigate the uncertainty presented by terrorism, narcotics trafficking, cyber-security, transnational crime, international conflict, disasters, and other threats and hazards to global security. Who we do it for: Customer sectors that include defense, intelligence, national security, government agencies and international. How we do it: Leverage top talent with a constellation of extraordinary partners to craft the right solutions. Demonstrate incomparable agility and efficiency by overcoming the obstacles that encumber other large complex organizations. Deliver innovative solutions with certainty, urgency, and efficiency through by our outcome-based culture. Simply put… we get things done.

title: Engineering & Quality Control Operations Manager (Administrative)
company: Environment Chemical Corporation International (ECCI). Burlingame, CA
description: • Inspected project sites for completion and to ensure quality control. • Submitted comprehensive daily reports to ECCI Headquarters in Iraq, Jordan, and US. • Maintained Project Progress Report, Quality Control Report, and Accident/Incident Reports. • Worked as main recruiter and responsible for hiring Local National (LN) employees for engineering, administrative, security, and janitorial positions. • Training the new engineers and admin assistants on their daily duties and introducing them to the system. • Responsible for hiring paperwork and reviewing the time sheets. • Managing the inventory system. • Managing the company villas and accommodations for the LNs, Third Country Nationals (TCNs), and US Military Distinguished Visitors (DVs). • Reviewing the samples submitted by the subcontractors and compared it with standard requirements and upload it to the portal daily to be reviewed by design center from both the Air Force Center for Engineering and the Environment (AFCEE) and Multi-National Security Transition Command – Iraq (MNSTC-I) TITLE II Engineers. • Submitted Force Protection reports to ECCI Security Manager based on information submitted by the ECCI field engineers located at military bases and police stations. Communicated with the US and Iraqi Armies to follow up on the reports. • Generated accountability reports for all North Region employees and submitted to headquarters daily • Submitted weekly and monthly projects reports and assisted Site Managers with scheduling, In-Progress Reports (IPRs), and work plans. • Communicated with subcontractors; coordinated and scheduled meetings between scores of subcontractors and senior project managers. • Preparing all paper work and coordinating for final inspection of buildings, and maintaining daily warranty reports based on requirements from the US Army compared to the maintenance repairs reported from the subcontractors.

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
description: SBS is an 14+ year old, Technology Services Organization that provides IT infrastructure design, integration, and operation services to corporate, non-profit, and government customers. SBS encompasses the full spectrum of infrastructure technologies including the latest network, server, storage, disaster recovery, security and Internet technologies. Responsible for full life-cycle recruiting including, screening and negotiating hiring packages for Technical Professionals within the Government and Commercial Markets nationwide Skill sets responsible for recruiting include, but not limited to: - Enterprise Network Design Engineers (Cleared and Non-Cleared) - Senior Windows Systems Engineers/Architects (Cleared and Non-Cleared) - EMC/HP/HDS/SUN/Dell Storage Area Network (SAN) Engineers - Backup and Recovery Specialists - Senior Database Administrators

summary: Senior Technical Recruiter supporting the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense and Commercial Sector. Full life-cycle technical recruiting experience, specializing in hard to fill positions; focused on cleared candidates supporting various government agencies with primary work experience with DOD and IC, clearances ranging from Top Secret to TS/SCI with Full Scope Polygraph. Eleven years of practical experience delivering Information Technology resource solutions as a Senior Recruiter, HR Professional and Talent Acquisition Consultant. Core strengths include IT Strategy and Vision, providing solution to the leadership and management teams of large-scale integration efforts, facilitating communication with stakeholders, vendors and partners, and client relationship management. Recruits cleared and non-cleared expert level SAN/NAS Engineers – - Enterprise Network Engineers (Brocade, McData, Cisco) - SAN Administrators, Migration and Implementation Engineers - HP/3PAR/NetApp/HDS/EMC Storage Area Network (SAN) Engineers - Back up and Recovery Specialists Partners & Agencies Supported: Government: CIA, NRO, DoD, NGA, NSA. Storage Vendors: DELL, NetApp, HP, Hitachi, EMC, IBM, VMware

title: Senior Technical Recruiter
description: PGTEK develops geospatial and datacenter applications that provide clients the data they need for making operational and strategic decisions. They develop innovative solutions by integrating source code and intellectual property with market leading tools and products. In addition to geospatial focused work, PGTEK's Data Center Solutions Group develops, supports and implements complex IT solutions for clients and partners throughout the United States in both the public and private sector. Partners include some of the world’s most successful and well known technology companies, such as Hitachi Data Systems, EMC, NetApp, Hewlett-Packard, Dell,Brocade and more. Source and recruit top talented Systems and Network Architects, Systems Administrators, Engineers, Developers, Project Managers, DBA’s, GIS Analysts, Web Developers, Software Developers, etc. for PGTEK’s Intelligence Community contracts. Also recruit cleared and non-cleared expert level SAN/NAS Engineers such as; Enterprise Network Engineers (Brocade, McData, Cisco,) SAN Administrators and Implementation Engineers, Dell, NetApp, HP, 3PAR, HDS, SUN, EMC Storage Area Network (SAN) Engineers and Backup and Recovery Specialists for PGTEK’s Nationwide Datacenter Solutions Group. Solely manage full life-cycle recruitment of IT professionals with clearances ranging from Top Secret to TS/SCI Full Scope Polygraph for a large Intelligence Community (IC) client.

summary: Senior Technical Recruiter supporting the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense and Commercial Sector. Full life-cycle technical recruiting experience, specializing in hard to fill positions; focused on cleared candidates supporting various government agencies with primary work experience with DOD and IC, clearances ranging from Top Secret to TS/SCI with Full Scope Polygraph. Eleven years of practical experience delivering Information Technology resource solutions as a Senior Recruiter, HR Professional and Talent Acquisition Consultant. Core strengths include IT Strategy and Vision, providing solution to the leadership and management teams of large-scale integration efforts, facilitating communication with stakeholders, vendors and partners, and client relationship management. Recruits cleared and non-cleared expert level SAN/NAS Engineers – - Enterprise Network Engineers (Brocade, McData, Cisco) - SAN Administrators, Migration and Implementation Engineers - HP/3PAR/NetApp/HDS/EMC Storage Area Network (SAN) Engineers - Back up and Recovery Specialists Partners & Agencies Supported: Government: CIA, NRO, DoD, NGA, NSA. Storage Vendors: DELL, NetApp, HP, Hitachi, EMC, IBM, VMware

summary: Senior Technical Recruiter supporting the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense and Commercial Sector. Full life-cycle technical recruiting experience, specializing in hard to fill positions; focused on cleared candidates supporting various government agencies with primary work experience with DOD and IC, clearances ranging from Top Secret to TS/SCI with Full Scope Polygraph. Eleven years of practical experience delivering Information Technology resource solutions as a Senior Recruiter, HR Professional and Talent Acquisition Consultant. Core strengths include IT Strategy and Vision, providing solution to the leadership and management teams of large-scale integration efforts, facilitating communication with stakeholders, vendors and partners, and client relationship management. title: Enterprise Technical Recruiter
description: Responsible for full life cycle recruiting, targeting competitors, engaging with prospects via various social networks, including technology specific websites, in order to build effective candidate relationships and identify, screen, and present outstanding candidates to leading fortune 500 firms. Implement and maximize high-impact recruiting tools, systems, and processes, addressing job requirements to meet business needs, and satisfy requirements. Oversee all aspects of the staffing process between candidates and Hiring Managers: interviews, start dates, pre-placement paperwork, background checks, drug screens, reference checks, timesheets, salary negotiation, compensation, offer letters, expense reports, benefits, etc. Successfully sourced/staffed candidates in several domains (e.g., Technical, Financial, Marketing, Operations, Creative, H.R., etc.) for a wide variety of positions and technologies, which include: Oracle, Java, .NET, Ecommerce, Web Developers, Program/Project Managers, Business Analysts (Technical and Financial), Systems Analysts, Infrastructure Management, Data/Database Management, Quality Assurance, Software Development, Security, Desktop Support, Help Desk, Content Marketing Managers, UI/UX Developers & Designers, Pre-Sales Engineers, and much more. Train, develop, and mentor junior staff members, fostering strong partnerships with our Strategic Account Teams and Vendor Management System (VMS) clients. Robert Half Technology is a leading provider of IT professionals on a project and full-time basis. We specialize in initiatives ranging from web development and systems integration to network security and technical support.

title: Recruiting Manager and Marketing Liaison
description: Effectively develop, implement, and administer recruiting plans by translating business unit objectives and strategies to develop our unique brand and facilitate business growth. Plan and conduct meetings to enforce company policy and procedures for all contractors and employees. Process all needed forms for the hiring and teaming of contractors prior to bids. Network and coordinate recruiting initiatives. Plan and administer the firm’s marketing operations budget and support development of regional marketing budgets. Oversee business development activities including all recruiting and hiring of new talent by utilizing web based recruiting search engines. Utilize internal candidate database of all potential hires, employees and contractors. Work as a liaison between contractors and owner in order to complete jobs. Provide customer service to clients and potential hires, working within organizations and teaming up with their Human Resource Department to meet specific needs.

Bragg, NOVA, OCONUS, Southern VA, Southern GA with active TS/SCI Clearances If you are interested, forward your resume to CFuller@caci.com. The majority of my open funded roles require significant targeting experience. So regardless of discipline, if you are interested and have at least 8 years of experience, send your resume! Six3 Systems, Inc. (Six3) provides strategic solutions to U.S. Government agencies in the Intelligence, Defense, and Civilian communities. Our teams are highly adept at solving complex problems utilizing the convergence of top-line subject matter expertise and leading-edge technology solutions, empowering decision-makers to make better mission-critical decisions. Our teams excel in the areas of collection, processing, analysis, and security. We have operational personnel stationed around the world in support of our customers' missions. Six3 comprises a professional staff with substantial experience in personnel/document/physical security, Homeland security, counterintelligence, human intelligence, measurement and signature intelligence, biometrics, research and technology, critical infrastructure protection and force protection. Our mission is to provide subject matter expertise and strategic solutions for our country's most sensitive national security agencies and critical missions. Our support includes security specialists, intelligence analysts, counterintelligence professionals, forensic technicians, systems engineering, chief scientists and thought leaders, and senior program advisors

title: COO / Founder
description: John Goodenow serves as the COO and Founder of The Intelligence Community, LLC. Mr. Goodenow founded The Intelligence Community group on LinkedIn in November of 2008. The group has grown to be the largest group on LinkedIn dedicated to Intelligence and National Security Professionals, with over 50,000 members and over 1,000 profiles vetted each month for membership. In April of 2012 he founded The Intelligence Community, LLC in Partnership with Graham Plaster and Kurt Marissa. As COO he oversees all aspects all aspects of the organization while maintaining an active role in the Risk Mitigation and Investigative service offerings. Mr. Goodenow is also a Licensed Private Investigator conducting investigations for corporate and private clients since 1995, with a passion for, and specializing in the art of surveillance. He has surrounded himself with similar investigators that follow their passions, specializing in their respective investigative discipline. He has been successful serving clients from the corporate and private sector, utilizing this network of specialist to achieve excellence in his field. With a reputation of excellence in the art of surveillance, Mr. Goodenow was recruited as a Surveillance Role Player to support HUMINT training for the Government and Military. He was quickly recognized for his ability to learn and adapt to team surveillance within the training environment and his ability to teach surveillance, surveillance detection and counter-surveillance at the highest levels. Mr. Goodenow also authored and instructs the 'Surveillance Information Collection and Analysis (SICA)' course designed to teach students the nuances of information collection and link analysis during the surveillance process. Mr. Goodenow was pivotal in the integration of a surveillance role-player package into existing HUMINT training for the Marine Corps MEU and MEF, further enhancing the student experience and lessons learned.

Train new contractors in team surveillance and how it differs in the training environment as opposed to real world. INVESTIGATIVE Surveillance Specialist. We train US Government & Military Intelligence personnel in latest tactics and techniques of surveillance, surveillance detection, and counter surveillance, so you can be assured our Investigators are 2nd to none! Specialties: Surveillance Counter Surveillance Surveillance Detection Route Planning &Analysis HUMINT, Counter Terrorism Training, Situational Awareness Training, Vulnerability Assessments, Investigative Services; Surveillance Insurance Fraud Corporate Investigations Domestic Investigations Child custody Missing persons Electronic Countermeasures. title: Creator / Moderator
description: The largest group on Linkedin dedicated to Government and Military Intelligence Professionals. (50,000+ members approved) and approx. 1200 request to join the group every month! summary: The Intelligence Community, LLC operates The National Security Freelance Marketplace at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com (Coming 03/2015), www.TheSourceWORLDBEAT.com, Live Networking Events, the 50,000+ member LinkedIn Group The Intelligence Community and The Intelligence Community private networking site at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com INTELLIGENCE Integrated Surveillance / CS / SD platforms into existing USMC HUMINT training platforms Support various levels of Government & Military HUMINT training through Surveillance / CS / SD support platforms Scenario Development –Customize Surveillance / CS / SD platforms to replicate the urban FIS/OPFOR threat in the training scenario Event Liaison between Mentors/Instructors and the Surveillance Teams during training events, ensuring operational integrity is maintained between surveillance teams and the other event participants. Authored and instruct “Surveillance, Information Collection & Analysis” (SICA) course. An advanced surveillance course that is scenario driven & designed to build on participants existing surveillance skill set through multiple unit surveillance exercises, the collection of information, and link analysis. Train new contractors in team surveillance and how it differs in the training environment as opposed to real world. INVESTIGATIVE Surveillance Specialist. We train US Government & Military Intelligence personnel in latest tactics and techniques of surveillance, surveillance detection, and counter surveillance, so you can be assured our Investigators are 2nd to none! Specialties: Surveillance Counter Surveillance Surveillance Detection Route Planning &Analysis HUMINT, Counter Terrorism Training, Situational Awareness Training, Vulnerability Assessments, Investigative Services; Surveillance Insurance Fraud Corporate Investigations Domestic Investigations Child custody Missing persons Electronic Countermeasures. Training High Profile

summary: The Intelligence Community, LLC operates The National Security Freelance Marketplace at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com (Coming 03/2015), www.TheSourceWORLDBEAT.com, Live Networking Events, the 50,000+ member LinkedIn Group The Intelligence Community and The Intelligence Community private networking site at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com INTELLIGENCE Integrated Surveillance / CS / SD platforms into existing USMC HUMINT training platforms Support various levels of Government & Military HUMINT training through Surveillance / CS / SD support platforms Scenario Development –Customize Surveillance / CS / SD platforms to replicate the urban FIS/OPFOR threat in the training scenario Event Liaison between Mentors/Instructors and the Surveillance Teams during training events, ensuring operational integrity is maintained between surveillance teams and the other event participants. Authored and instruct “Surveillance, Information Collection & Analysis” (SICA) course. An advanced surveillance course that is scenario driven & designed to build on participants existing surveillance skill set through multiple unit surveillance exercises, the collection of information, and link analysis. Train new contractors in team surveillance and how it differs in the training environment as opposed to real world. INVESTIGATIVE Surveillance Specialist. We train US Government & Military Intelligence personnel in latest tactics and techniques of surveillance, surveillance detection, and counter surveillance, so you can be assured our Investigators are 2nd to none! Specialties: Surveillance Counter Surveillance Surveillance Detection Route Planning &Analysis HUMINT, Counter Terrorism Training, Situational Awareness Training, Vulnerability Assessments, Investigative Services; Surveillance Insurance Fraud Corporate Investigations Domestic Investigations Child custody Missing persons Electronic Countermeasures. Training High Profile

summary: The Intelligence Community, LLC operates The National Security Freelance Marketplace at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com (Coming 03/2015), www.TheSourceWORLDBEAT.com, Live Networking Events, the 50,000+ member LinkedIn Group The Intelligence Community and The Intelligence Community private networking site at www.TheIntelligenceCommunity.com INTELLIGENCE Integrated Surveillance / CS / SD platforms into existing USMC HUMINT training platforms Support various levels of Government & Military HUMINT training through Surveillance / CS / SD support platforms Scenario Development –Customize Surveillance / CS / SD platforms to replicate the urban FIS/OPFOR threat in the training scenario Event Liaison between Mentors/Instructors and the Surveillance Teams during training events, ensuring operational integrity is maintained between surveillance teams and the other event participants. Authored and instruct “Surveillance, Information Collection & Analysis” (SICA) course. An advanced surveillance course that is scenario driven & designed to build on participants existing surveillance skill set through multiple unit surveillance exercises, the collection of information, and link analysis. Train new contractors in team surveillance and how it differs in the training environment as opposed to real world. INVESTIGATIVE Surveillance Specialist. We train US Government & Military Intelligence personnel in latest tactics and techniques of surveillance, surveillance detection, and counter surveillance, so you can be assured our Investigators are 2nd to none! Specialties: Surveillance Counter Surveillance Surveillance Detection Route Planning &Analysis HUMINT, Counter Terrorism Training, Situational Awareness Training, Vulnerability Assessments, Investigative Services; Surveillance Insurance Fraud Corporate Investigations Domestic Investigations Child custody Missing persons Electronic Countermeasures. Training High Profile

title: Owner and CEO
description: Ember Essentials, letting the natural you shine through! Here at Ember, we recognize that a significant amount of what you put on your skin is absorbed into your body. With people becoming more health conscious and careful about what they eat, they should really be more concerned about what they put on their body, including their skin and hair, as well. Many of the harsh chemicals in commercial soaps and shampoos can make their way into your body and negatively impact your health. At Ember, we know there's a better way, and that's why we're here! We are dedicated to providing superior soaps and shampoos that will let the natural you shrine though. To achieve our mission, our soaps and shampoos are made by hand, using pure plant and vegetable based oils, which have been carefully chosen to create soaps with excellent lathering, moisturizing, and cleansing abilities. Our products are always sulfate, detergent, phthalate, petrochemical, and paraben free, and we use only natural colorants and ingredients in the making of our products in order to promote the healthiest and happiest you. Additionally, we use the old fashioned, cold process soap making method, retaining the natural glycerin in our soaps, which help the skin to attract and retain its own natural moisture, leaving it feeling soft and pampered.

title: Security and Intelligence Specialist
description: **Served as acting Physical Security and Antiterrorism Specialist **I am an Oakridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE) contractor working for U.S. Army Public Health Command.** • Provide policy guidance and implementation on a broad range of security work that includes: personnel security, physical security, operations security, information security, and antiterrorism • Develop standard operating procedures (SOPs), create security continuity reference materials, and train incoming Security Specialists • Adjudicate personnel security clearance suitability, remediate associated issues, and track individuals in JPAS • Serve as facility custodian of classified storage equipment and devices, including safes, alarms, and cipher locks • Deliver security briefings to educate personnel of their security responsibilities in accordance with DoD policy • Perform regular site inspections and security tests to ensure compliance with DoD security regulations • Analyze both open source and classified information to produce intelligence reports for the General’s Black Book • Act as Personnel Security Specialist and Physical Security Specialist as required

title: Executive Manager
description: As Chief, Recruitment Center, I am responsible for the coordination of recruitment initiatives and monitoring hiring needs and metrics to meet CIA mission requirements. The Recruitment Center works to: Recruit and hire the most highly qualified and diverse men and women to ensure a workforce with a broad range of ethnic and cultural backgrounds, language expertise, and educational experiences Establish and foster productive partnerships nationwide with colleges, universities, professional networks, and organizations that are key sources of top talent Engage with minority affinity groups to establish long-term relationships and strategies for recruiting candidates Reach a nationwide audience of competitive candidates for career opportunities through innovative advertising and marketing

summary: CIA Vision, Mission & Values Vision One Agency. One Community. An Agency unmatched in its core capabilities, functioning as one team, fully integrated into the Intelligence Community. Mission We are the nation’s first line of defense. We accomplish what others cannot accomplish and go where others cannot go. We carry out our mission by: Collecting information that reveals the plans, intentions and capabilities of our adversaries and provides the basis for decision and action. Producing timely analysis that provides insight, warning and opportunity to the President and decisionmakers charged with protecting and advancing America’s interests. Conducting covert action at the direction of the President to preempt threats or achieve US policy objectives. Core Values Service. We put Country first and Agency before self. Quiet patriotism is our hallmark. We are dedicated to the mission, and we pride ourselves on our extraordinary responsiveness to the needs of our customers. Integrity. We uphold the highest standards of conduct. We seek and speak the truth—to our colleagues and to our customers. We honor those Agency officers who have come before us and we honor the colleagues with whom we work today. Excellence. We hold ourselves—and each other—to the highest standards. We embrace personal accountability. We reflect on our performance and learn from that reflection

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Corporate Operations / Advanced Enterprise Strategic Planning / Capture & Business Development / Enterprise Performance Management National Intelligence – Defense & Aerospace – Commercial Ventures Top Secret Clearance - DoD Active Energetic executive leader who leverages inspiration and innovative thinking with keen business practices to drive productivity. In these tough times, has the extensive personal relationships combined with unique training and experience needed to identify opportunities, establish meaningful pipelines, build cohesive teams in diverse environments, win contracts and ultimately grow the bottom line. Recognized expert on the subject of business process re-engineering (BPR), performance management and continual service improvement (CSI), and experienced at making complicated organizations run more effectively and efficiently. Highly qualified at helping reduce risks and ensuring successful completion of large-scale programs. Veteran leader in strategically planning, shaping and implementing corporate culture change to make organizations more effective at achieving mission. LEADERSHIP ACUMEN - Executive Program Management and Organizational Development - Operational Turnaround and Continuous Process Improvement - Strategic Planning, Business Growth and Brand Management - Maximizing Performance Objectives and Improving the Bottom Line - Strategic Alliances, Partnerships and Joint Ventures - Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Risk Management - Quality Talent Recruitment and Career Management of Staff - Customer Relationship Management and Excellent Interpersonal Skills Certified Professional Contracts Manager (CPCM) Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) Certified ITIL Foundation v3 Certified Six Sigma Greenbelt

title: Chief Operating Officer
description: Metters Industries, Inc. is a privately held firm founded in 1981 providing a broad range of technical services including enterprise IT services, cybersecurity solutions, logistics and systems engineering, and simulation & training systems. With its state-of-the-art 74,000 sq/ft manufacturing facility, Metters is a world leader in the design and production and of Fixed Wing/Helicopter Simulated Flight Controls, Nuclear Submarine Engine Control Room Simulators and Simulated Land/Sea Mines used to support advanced military training operations. Reporting to CEO, oversaw delivery and drove growth of a comprehensive array of technical services. Customers include DHS, US Army, US Navy, US Air Force, DOT, NASA, FAA, HUD, VA, HHS and commercial clients. **A “Make It Happen” passionate leader, determined problem solver, team builder, innovative business strategist, creative revenue executive** Commanded multiple senior executive direct reports overseeing programs delivering continuous integration and continuous delivery services across CONUS and OCONUS. Led development and implementation of strategic planning initiatives. Worked with department heads, steered individual department plans for upcoming year, including sales & production goals, budgets, staffing and structural changes. ENTERPRISE IT SOLUTIONS • Business Process Management • Information Systems and Applications Design • Telecommunications and Network Security • Software and Web-based Development • C&A and Continuous Monitoring • Infrastructure and Network Support LOGISTICS & SYSTEMS ENGINEERING • Program Management • Process Reengineering • Supply Chain Management • Training • Lifecycle Support • Management Support Services SIMULATION & TRAINING • System & Component Design • Software & Courseware Development • Hardware, Software, and System Integration • Reverse Engineering and Rapid Prototyping • Composite Material and Custom Manufacturing • Field Engineering and Support Services

title: Vice President, DISA Operations
description: DMI is a global leader renowned for break-through solutions in Enterprise Mobility and emerging IT services leveraging mobile technologies and big data insights to drive better business performance. DMI is a premier mobile device management, mobile application development and web solution provider which delivers more than 500 mobile applications and commercial websites per year for many of the world’s largest brands. Headed all of company's business operations and growth initiatives for Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA), Defense Spectrum Office / Joint Spectrum Center, Joint Staff Support Center (JSSC) Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and related customers. **Applies keen business insights and in-depth knowledge of improving operations while leading tactical activities to improve the bottom line** - Bid, won and maintained executive program oversight of DMI’s flagship mobility contract: ‘Mobile Device Management (MDM) system and Mobile Application Storefront (MAS)’ with Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). This groundbreaking contract equips DISA to become a Mobile Virtual Network Operator (MVNO) to centrally manage & monitor millions of global mobile devices for all of DoD. - Led preparation and submittal of many complex IT engineering proposals for new business with DISA, CYBERCOM, NSA and CIA. Received awards for six new prime contracts with DISA. - Worked closely with all levels of all non-operational depts including HR, Recruiting, Finance, Contracts, Pricing, Proposals, Marketing & Security. Built outstanding rapport with leaders of all of these orgs and leveraged relationships to ensure peak execution of Division operations. - Personally established excellent, firsthand fluid relationships with numerous federal stakeholders in addition to various corporate partner executives. Received frequent acknowledgements from federal client sources regarding their renewed happiness for support.

title: Senior Vice President and General Manager, Intelligence Programs Group
description: Senior leader for one of five corporate groups. Responsible for running all of firm’s business with US Intelligence Community. Customers included DNI, NSA, CIA, NRO, NGA, DIA, DISA, White House Communication Agency (WHCA), USMC and Naval Research Labs. **Expeditious leader who turns around organizations by optimizing internal structure/processes, branding initiatives, marketing collateral, website, standard project management practices, employee relation / satisfaction, flawless service delivery and customer relationships** - Triaged operations to establish control, identified broken processes, mitigated legacy revenue losses, reformed dysfunctional business practices and reduced inefficiencies. - Transformed GM planning process to focus on strategic, robust growth via action items and accountability. - Reinvigorated stale strategic alliances and instated fresh mix of new partnerships. - Quickly identified staffing of personnel vacancies as critical area for improvement at NCI. Worked closely with leadership and Head of Recruiting to overhaul internal resources and processes for US Intelligence Community. Historic improvements achieved in only seven months. - Enhanced public image and recognition of the firm's name within the Intelligence Community through new business development efforts, community outreach and aggressive networking. - Effectively supervised a critical ACAT-1 program (with monthly Congressional oversight) for development of major IT system as the prime vendor with IC. - Ensured consistent, high quality delivery of cyber security, analytics / enrichment, geospatial visualization, agile software development, high-performance / grid computing, mission analysis, linguistics, and forensics for the Group’s customers. - Championed establishment of Innovation Council, a collection of volunteer technologists and internal SME’s working in a unified way to address tough mission challenges.

title: Cyber Operations Consultant
description: The Goyak Group is a gourmet consulting firm providing highly specialized advisory services to sophisticated clients including advanced strategy development, business analyses, implementation of strategic capture & marketing operations and proposal support. Goyak offers access to veteran SME’s, former industry senior executives / leaders and elite specialists across a broad range of technical and complex management disciplines. Hand-selected as interim Cyber Strategic Account Manager (SAM) to US Intelligence Community (17 agencies) on behalf of Northrop Grumman. Exclusive Cyber SAM team was comprised of four distinctively seasoned executives; other three team members covered Army, Navy and Air Force markets. **Exercises broad focus on creating value over and above specific opportunities, often including value co-creation, customer satisfaction improvement, rigorous application of company resources, and operational & structural alignment with account direction or needs** - Interfaced with heads of IC agencies, key officials, industry leaders and SME’s to attain acute insight into mission-related Cyber Security and Cyber Warfare challenges. - Leveraged special relationships and robust research skills to carefully derive each Agency’s strategic direction, mission difficulties, interdependencies, political snags, acquisition preferences, financial viability and respective management philosophy. - Concentrated on pipeline front-end analyses. Facilitated ‘deep dive’ strategy sessions, technical exchanges and mission alignment discussions with leadership. - Developed inventive capture strategies, including: customer engagements, teaming strategies, technical solution development, competitive analysis and Blackhats; orchestrating & realizing acquisition cycle milestones and passing opportunities to respective Business Development & Capture Managers.

title: Vice President of IT Services Line of Business
description: Executive leader with operational and P&L responsibilities for Tetra Tech’s IT Services Business Unit serving across dispersed locations. Key federal clients included FAA, DHS, NASA and National Science Foundation (NSF). **Talented operations executive offering an excellent track record in delivering results across complex organizations, improving top- and bottom-line growth performance, leading change management initiatives, and driving innovation across the enterprise** - Penetrated a new market, increased headcount and increased annual revenues within first six months. Identified, qualified and initiated pursued capture of $100M+ in opportunities with new and existing customers within first six months. - Conceived, developed and matured a comprehensive, inorganic acquisition strategy for the IT Services Business Unit. Initiated due diligence and conducted preliminary analysis of prospect firms for the purposes of assessing value as strategic alliances and inorganic acquisitions. Launched preliminary discussions with firms. - Worked closely with staff and internal support departments to establish improved project management, financial management, human capital management and customer management practices. Coached, mentored and developed key staff members. GSA Alliant GWAC Program Manager for Tetra Tech Corporation.

title: Senior Program Manager - Enterprise and Mission Solutions
description: Senior Strategic Business Adviser to federal senior executives and officials at Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) including the CIO. **Strategic thinker who designs and implements operational plans and inspires leadership within all departments and fellow executives** - Key source of farsighted thought leadership and recognized business architect for the development of sophisticated, integrated corporate strategic planning and enterprise performance management systems to align multi-billion dollar, globally dispersed business activities to strategy of the agency (DISA Campaign Plan). - Provided unequaled expert advisory support at all levels of the global telecommunications organization, including the strategic-level enhancement of corporate readiness and response, emerging market trends, operational improvement via BPR, process improvement and applied business analytics across the client’s international cadre of people, processes, and organizational components. - Personally designed enterprise-wide blueprints for new methodologies enabling DISA to build and drive momentum across the organization focused on successfully delivering major programs on-time and within budget using fewer resources. - Participated in the ongoing delivery of complex change programs that enhance the client's business and served as a primary ‘Thought Leader’ in the development of business process re-engineering solutions for the entire combat support agency. - Pioneered creative solutions and methodologies; developed "thoughtware" and "point-of-view" documents. - Continuously worked to improve agency’s processes, tools, and project management practices in process excellence through key principles from Six Sigma, Balanced Scorecard, CoBIT, PMBoK, Earned Value Management, and ITIL v3. - Guided agency’s ability to translate diverse and complex strategic initiatives for funding into tactical, executable plans. Instructed on performance-based contracting.

title: Deputy Division Manager - Advanced Intelligence Solutions Operation
description: Integral leader within Applied Systems Division, a foremost provider in fulfilling some of the DoD and IC’s special classified software requirements. **Senior executive offering proven ability to shape meaningful organizational performance objectives and achieve these strategic goals by way of prominent contributions to profitability, project management, process optimization and customer satisfaction & service delivery** - Spearheaded establishment of business pipeline for the Division valued at $250M+ in conjunction with developing strategic alliances and capture strategies. - Shaped and implemented strategic direction for Division’s business planning and management activities tied to financial targets, performance goal setting, revenue generation, meeting customer expectations, program schedule & cost adherence, staff development and employee retention plus other assigned key performance metrics.

title: Corporate Account Manager (DIESCON 3 IDIQ PMO Manager)
description: Chief point of contact for SAIC overseeing and coordinating all corporate business pursuits leveraging the 'DIESCON III' IDIQ contract with DIA. Accountable for developing and advancing trusted relationships internally across the corporation and externally throughout the US Intelligence Community to increase usage of the contract vehicle. **Standards-focused leader proficient in directing multi-site operations, business model restructuring, building pipelines, cost control and risk management with adept management of organizational diversity. Drives excellence by relentlessly focusing on customer satisfaction** - Directed key program functions for large portfolio of contracts with DIA. Founded and led program’s first official PMO; standardized procedures; structured business protocols and set up training regimens / mentoring support for PM’s. - Designed and implemented full range of new PMO rules of engagement, measurable performance standards and operations policies including business development, capture management, customer relations, strategic planning, communication, program management / execution and conflict resolution methods. - Interacted directly with DIA’s senior level managers and executives to provide operational expertise and project direction. Established systematic order to the program which improved overall customer satisfaction and fueled financial transformation.

Identified and pursed business opportunities with potential and existing clients. Led corrective action procedures and improvement efforts when necessary.

title: Strategic Planner for US Intelligence Community
description: Served as lead Strategic Planner for a unique government-wide consortium within the US Intelligence Community, comprised of specialized personnel from non-intelligence and intelligence organizations, including various elements of CIA, DIA, NGA, DTRA, NSA and other military commands providing unmatched intelligence to high-level national policymakers, diverse military forces and relevant commanders around the world. **Extensive background developing, implementing, enterprise business planning initiatives and processes for large, complex organizations** - Helped reverse historically abandoned investments of vital national intelligence programs experiencing severe cost issues due to ineffective planning and poor management. Created historical achievement of operational continuity across Center by way of custom-designed decision-making tool that was personally conceived, developed and implemented. Results ultimately led to long term continuance of Analysis Center’s existence, which was facing foreseeable disbandment by Congress. - Championed changes that drove unprecedented costs savings and improved efficiencies through innovative uses of technology and continual service improvement via structured strategic management. Creatively led unparalleled benchmarking efforts in identifying best practices and attaining next level of process excellence objectives. Responsible for management and direction of multiple, large and complex strategy management consulting projects. - Developed trusted strategic partnerships with senior Government leaders, key clients, and other stakeholders such as high ranking officials within the National Intelligence Council (NIC), Office of Secretary of Defense for Intelligence (OSD-I), and Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI). Enabled executive Government leaders to define their organizational vision and determine direction of change through a period of historic Intelligence Community transformation.

title: Special Advisor to the Joint Chiefs of Staff (Pentagon)
description: Strategic management consultant providing counseling and advanced business support to the principal advisor to the Director of the Joint Staff on all acquisition, contracting, and appropriated funds issues. The Joint Staff Comptroller is responsible for contract planning, requirements development, federal acquisition regulation compliance, financial planning, programming and budgeting, funds execution and accounting for over $1 billion annually. Provided expert advisory services in the acquisition management areas of competition advocacy, appropriation accountability, acquisition policy, acquisition strategy, matters of fiscal and contract law, pre-contract planning and proposed acquisition legislation. Recognized as the single most expert on performance-based acquisitions on the Joint Staff. Participated in development of lesson plans, and personally conducted training of 200+ Joint Staff Action Officers annually with the principles of federal contracting, Joint Staff acquisition management functions and detailed instructions on accomplishing high profile, mission-oriented objectives through acquisitions. Instructed and consulted internal and external clients on the principles, strategic applications and tactical implementation of Performance-Based Acquisitions.

title: Contracting Officer
description: Assignments include rotational roles at NGA and NRO Acted as chief decision maker in the proposal review process and had ultimate responsibility for negotiation of financial, legal, security, and work scope aspects of contracts to ensure that resulting agreements were consistent with program needs, and established Agency procurement practices. Administered a large portfolio of sophisticated, complex, and hypersensitive international IT development and IT service contracts for national security valued at >$500M. Directly engaged in the daily management of operational activities for 400+ cleared contractor personnel worldwide. Highly trained to be an expert “Lead Negotiator” with extraordinary experience earned while negotiating on behalf of the US Intelligence Community in various clandestine international arenas. Represented organizational interests in various inter- and intra-organizational forums, conferences, and meetings. Helped prepare, defend and execute budgets plus assisted implementation of direct and indirect cost control measures. Developed and implemented metrics and processes necessary to achieve program goals. Formulated and aligned systems, protocols, policies, operational business strategies and controls that supported the covert mission and strategic direction of the organization’s programs, often under abnormally high stress conditions. Developed solutions to urgent crises and problems of unusual complexity requiring a high degree of ingenuity, creativity, and innovativeness. Unique solutions frequently served as precedents for future decisions within the organization and throughout the agency and beyond.

title: Financial Consultant (Internship) — Commercial Accounts Specialist and Capital Asset Analyst
description: Background: Returned to Texas A&M University to complete undergraduate degree after 5 years of active duty service in US Navy. As a student in a Top Ten Undergrad Business College, I competed for and was selected for 1 of 2 highly sought after positions for 6-month internships with the largest ML branch in the local region. Only 2 interns are selected by this ML office each 6 month cycle from hundreds of highly qualified candidates. Duties and Responsibilities: Initiated client contact (new and existing), maintained correspondence, and assisted in negotiating commercial financial service accounts with multiple companies having a combined value of over $40 million during summer internship. Analyzed industry forecasts and competitors’ products to generate enterprise-level cost-saving ideas for existing commercial clientele. Trained and experienced in Business Process Re-engineering design, implementation, and management strategies including exposure to conducting Activity-Based Costing analyses.

title: Aircrewman, Aviation Electronics Technician
description: Fleet Air Reconnaissance Squadron Four (VQ-4), US Navy, Tinker AFB, Oklahoma City, OK www.tacamo.org Certified “Naval Air Warfare Specialist” Flew classified missions. Operated, maintained, and repaired tens of millions of dollars worth of specialized electronic equipment during flight as an In-Flight Electronics Technician and as an Airborne Communications Operator onboard each of the US Navy squadron’s fleet of seven Boeing E6 Mercury aircraft. Each aircraft (only 16 exist worldwide) provides the President and the National Military Command Center (NMCC) authorities with a survivable communications link to nation’s nuclear weapons arsenal.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.

summary: Talent Acquisition Professional with over 17 years of experience. Heavily experienced within the National Security Sector with an emphasis in Sourcing and Capture. Take pleasure in Sourcing, Networking, and Strategizing. I am also the Facilitator of Project SAVE (Staffing Alliance of Virginia Employers) which is an organization catering to recruiters and networking. Project SAVE was founded by Gary Cluff in 1990. It has assisted recruiters, HR Professionals, and job seekers for over 23 years. To learn about monthly meetings, please visit and join our Meetup Group at: http://www.meetup.com/http-www-cluffassociates-com/ or visit our website at www.project-s-a-v-e.com.
